p: Ultrasound can be categorized according to the used frequency (kHz) and the generated energy intensity power (W). Also, it could be categorized based on sound intensity (W/m 2) or sound energy density (Ws/m 3) [ 23]. According to the used frequency, it can be categorized into high and low frequencies. High-frequency and intensity US are those using frequency higher than 100 kHz, and intensity from 10 to 1000 W/cm 2, whereas the low-frequency and intensity US uses frequency lower than 100 kHz, and intensity lower than 3 W/cm 2 [ [25], [26]].
